p: Rheumatoid arthritis can also be fought with plants [ 125] whose extracts can be used at least to reduce the quantities of methotrexate, one of the elective drugs used in the treatment of this pathology. As for the Lamium genus, the evidence that some species can provide benefits in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis is quite weak [ 126] and are mostly speculative and based on the antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties of L. album extracts.
